title.narrative: World Small Hydropower Development Report (WSHPDR) next edition preparation and maintenance of knowledge platform www.smallhydroworld.org

description.narrative:
UNIDO, together with the International Centre on Small Hydro Power (ICSHP), successfully launched the World Small Hydropower Development Report 2013 (WSHPDR 2013) in late 2013, and the knowledge platform www.smallhydroworld.org in early 2014. This flagship assessment of UNIDO contains 20 regional overviews and 149 country-level reports on small hydropower (SHP) capacity, potential, legislation and barriers to development. The information is based on the contribution of more than 60 different authors and organizations from all over the world. This assessment is the world-first compilation of global SHP data. The platform and the report have since been received fantastically by the energy and climate change community and have reached a wide audience. Fostering the intense partnership, ICSHP has requested assistance from UNIDO for the continued publication of the report, which is planned to happen in regular intervals (biennially), and for maintenance and expansion of the knowledge platform www.smallhydroworld.org. ICSHP has been coordinating the initial collection and compilation of global data on small hydropower and UNIDO has been providing technical inputs and guidance to the process, facilitated the establishment of the knowledge platform and supported outreach activities through its network.
This project responds to the growing demand and interests from member states in SHP as a solution for inclusive and sustainable industrial development. This flagship knowledge sharing assessment of UNIDO will strengthen UNIDO’s leading role in the field of small hydropower for sustainable development. UNIDO should capitalize from the experiences gathered and position itself at the forefront of SHP knowledge management and will, through strongly liaising with national focal points in this matter, ensure national ownership with regards to contributions to the assessment. In UNIDO, through this continued initiative, will position itself at the forefront of the field of SHP for inclusive and sustainable industrial development.
The present project aims at continuing UNIDO’s previous efforts in this field and at strategically preparing the upcoming editions of the WSHPDR (tentatively 2016 and 2018) through the establishment of a network of national focal points, strategic focus setting and liaising with industry partners. UNIDO will also benefit from this effort for the design and preparation of SHP projects, such as GEF proposals.
